intro: Zosterophyllanthos zarumae, commonly known as the Zambian zosterophyllum, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Zambian region of Africa. It belongs to the family Zosterophyllaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that resemble those of ancient marine plants. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with a short, upright stem and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical significance lies in its evolutionary link to early land plants, offering insights into the transition from aquatic to terrestrial life. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
